definitions.definition: To cause the fiscal ruin of; to bankrupt or drive out of business.
examples: With all these purchases, you surely mean to ruin us!

definitions.definition: To destroy or render something no longer usable or operable .
examples: He ruined his new white slacks by accidentally spilling oil on them.

definitions.definition: To upset or overturn the plans or progress of, or to have a disastrous effect on something.
examples: My car breaking down just as I was on the road ruined my vacation.

definitions.definition: To make something less enjoyable or likeable .
examples: I used to love that song, but being assaulted when that song was playing ruined the song for me.

definitions.definition: To reveal the ending of (a story); to spoil .
To fall into a state of decay .
To seduce or debauch , and thus harm the social standing of.
examples: The young libertine was notorious for ruining local girls.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause the fiscal ruin of; to bankrupt or drive out of business.
secondary_definitions: To destroy or render something no longer usable or operable .
To upset or overturn the plans or progress of, or to have a disastrous effect on something.
To make something less enjoyable or likeable .
To reveal the ending of (a story); to spoil .
( obsolete ) To fall into a state of decay .
( transitive , historical ) To seduce or debauch , and thus harm the social standing of.
